{
  "Allegations" : "`CUSTOMER ALLEGED THAT HE WAS TOLD THAT IF HE PAID $35,000 INTO THE CONTRACT, THEN HE WOULD NOT HAVE TO MAKE ANY FURTHER PAYMENTS.  HE THEN RECEIVED A PREMIUM DUE ON HIS FIRST ANNIVERSARY.  MONETARY DAMAGES NOT ALLEGED`",
  "Settlement Amount" : "$67,800.00",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "N",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "",
  "Broker Comment" : "THE COMPANY ADJUSTED THE PRICE OF THE CONTRACT SO THAT NO FURTHER PREMIUM PAYMENTS ARE REQUIRED.  ESTIMATED COST $67,800. CUSTOMER PUT $35,000 INTO A VARIABLE LIFE POLICY. I TOLD THE CUSTOEMR THAT WE NEED TO REVIEW EACH YEAR TO SEE IF WE NEED TO MAKE ADJUSTMENTS.  AFTER I LEFT PRU IN 1993, I WAS NOT ABLE TO REVIEW.  SINCE NO ONE WAS REVIEWING, HE GOT BEHIND ON HIS PAYMENTS.  IF THERE WAS A PROBLEM AFTER THE FIRST YEAR, AS THE CUSTOMER STATES.  IT WOULD HAVE BEEN TAKEN CARE OF AT THAT POINT; NOT AFTER SIX YEARS."
}

{
  "Allegations" : "REGARDING THE PURCHASE OF THREE VARIABLE LIFE CONTRACTS AND A TRADITIONAL LIFE POLICY BETWEEN 1985 AND 1991, CUSTOMER ALLEGED, `PLEASE MAKE PRUDENTIAL TRANSFER OUR MONEY VIA 1035 EXCHANGE ON FOUR LIFE POLICIES WE ARE TRYING TO GET OUT OF`   MONETARY DAMAGES NOT ALLEGED",
